title: So riot is already turning back on their claim supporting offroles paired with radio silence.
body:
There is a growing number of disgruntled Irelia players that getting increasingly irate about the recent extreme hit to her ability to be able to viably jungle. The Q bonus damage to monsters was completely removed on top of the E damage to monsters being cut in half. As I have had the opportunity to try her in the jungle on the PBE I can say she sure as hell isn't going to be warping the jungle around her.

So why the complete silence from any rioter on this matter. The community would hope you would at least be waiting longer before blatantly turning back on the the claim of offrole support within such a short period of time. We would sure as hell want proper reasoning behind doing something that has been considered pretty thoughtless considering there were already pointed out issues before you decided to add more.

replies.body: The decision on this was made because the Irelia dev team felt like there was a legitimate chance her jungle performance would outshine her solo lane performance. If this was a brand new champion, that might be okay, but in her case, they thought it would be a large disservice to her current player base if they felt the champion they received with their update was no longer a solo laner. Yes, I'm aware that other champions have suffered this fate in the past. The intent is that jungling is still a legitimate option for Irelia upon release, and if it turns out to perform far worse than her solo lanes, we can buff it up to be closer to parity.
If you feel like it's a disservice to change a champs roll with a rework then why was Graves taken away from all the people who played him bot lane?

I think in this specific case it being quite a while ago before they solidly decided to support offrolling being the case. I think it was a much less considered point up to potentially being an ignored point for change.

I think with graves it was because he was in a larger class update and so it was like 1 or 2 people making all of the decisions about his changes and I bet they didnt expect for him to shift so dramatically.

I would assume that they hadn't anticipated that Graves would be an overpowered jungler when they reworked him.  I don't think he really jungled at all until the pros started abusing him as well.  Idk tho
It was a long time ago, back when they still did class updates. They said they won't do those anymore.

Yes, I'm aware that other champions have suffered this fate in the past. The intent is that jungling is still a legitimate option for Irelia upon release, and if it turns out to perform far worse than her solo lanes, we can buff it up to be closer to parity.

Part of the problem here is that if she's capable of jungling at all she'll most likely be better off just going jungle than she would top, top lane being what it is now :/

I think this should be a stronger poit for riot supporting her being able to off roll. I like to play diver champs but don't feel they can thrive as safely in top lane so go to jungle where you have the opportunity to choose to ignore the dangers that you don't have a choice about in lane. Irelia has had points in the past were she wasn't a good option but top lane was realistically her only choice. If the only choice isn't a good choice then there is no choice.

What is wrong with this? As long as she is a good solo laner what does it matter if she's also a good jungler? Solo laners aren't going to care if Irelia ends up being a very good jungler as long as she ends up as a good top laner as well.

I... kinda understand where he's coming from, kinda.

Like... if Irelia was reworked, and people discovered she's a better jungler than toplaner, then she would become a jungler in the eyes of the playerbase, and then Riot might balance her for jungle at the expense of her toplane, alienating those players.

I kinda think about it like... if they were to rework Sona, I would be pretty upset if she somehow turned out to be a better midlaner than support, as I hate Sona mid.

As long as Riot doesn't ruin her top lane potential then they won't care that her identity has been expanded. I appreciate not wanting to change her identity away from being a solo laner, but they don't HAVE to balance her into a jungler if she leans too far into being one.

Before those changes Irelia would have been a jungler to be feared, she had amazing clears and her ganks were top notch.  She would have been an extremely dominant jungler and that is something you don't want.  Try fighting to get her top lane without her being picked up by either jungler or being banned before you even get a chance.

I'm ok with some nerfs but these nerfs are massive. But hey, different* design choice.

The main issue here though is that that's not why they're nerfing it! They're not nerfing it because Irelia jungle is too strong for the meta to handle, they're nerfing it because they perceive Irelia fans as people who wouldn't want her to be able to jungle. If she ends up being problematic and her ability to jungle cannot be balanced then fine but they never gave it a chance and by the sound of it, they don't want to.

*edit here: derped the word choice.

It sounded more to me was that they didn't want to make Irelia a primary jungler, which with her kit as it was she would have been.  I agree they shouldn't nerf things out of off roles, but I don't think that was their primary intent here.  Plus the Rioter has said that they will buff it back up a bit if her jungling becomes completely bad.

If they had let her initial version hit live then they would have to do this then in response to her enormous jungle win rate.  Her clear speed was amazing, her dueling power is good, she has decent burst, and her ganking power is fantastic because of her easy to hit hard cc and double gap closer.  If they didn't cripple her clear she could be a top tier jungler easily and the other areas they can't hit without affecting her top lane.

Sure, but what Riot has been telling us is that they've been working on a design and balancing methodology to better allow champions to operate across multiple positions. The question here is: is Riot using this methodology on Irelia? If she turns out to be too weak or unhealthy a jungler, how hard is it going to be to make her jungling work? Just off the top of your head, which levers would you tune in order to adjust her jungling while minimally affecting her laning, and vice versa?

I can understand the thought. I don't like it or agree with it though, since taking her into the jungle is something I was really looking forward to being able to do with her personally, and considering the number of vocal people that this targeted nerf has made its way into a recognized issue with the community. Considering that it is fair to say that the devs are actually against against the community in this matter to be honest.

Again I can understand the concerns about jungle outperforming solo lane for irelia, before her clears were really not bad although not top of the food chain for that point but her ganks had the opportunity to be the point that really caused jungle to outshine lane. This isn't just a objective analysis but also comes from experience of being able to play on the PBE. The changes slowed down the clears which alone would have been a good way to tone down the ganks but the clears are now also quite drastically less healthy (just barely better than live irelia so pretty bad). I have made this point of suggestion time and time again about her healing needs to scale better for someone who's core items, because it feels increasingly less appreciated as she gets more items. 

**WHEN** it shows that the jungle nerfs went to far, but I'm sure you wont want to up her clear speed further increase the health of her clears through the Q healing. Assuming solo lane she'll be fine increase the heal on monsters by X%, her early jungle is healthier the clear speed is still toned down. If there is the possibility of her needing a buff all around, make the heal increase by X% for every Y% missing health, it would address the above concerns about it feeling less appreciated as she builds up, her damage is fine and frankly is in no need of buffs in my opinion. Considering the timing left it may be possible to implement the jungle specific consideration before last lock ins. Please consider it.

I've maimed Irelia for 3 seasons and have 800k mastery and in my opinion it would not be a disservice to let irelia be viable in the jungle. The only reason she may feel strong in the jungle is because of the current terrible meta of top lane. Ie. Tanks.

Would love to be able to play nidalee mid again as that was one of my first and favorite champions in the midlane when I started playing this game. I actually was hoping to play Irelia in the jungle after the update. I always thought her jungle clear was on the slower side, because Q/E mistakes felt like punishment during camps. Her new kit looks forgiving and removes her old status quo to win by 25min condition or go into lategame fall off. As an avid 5's player I considered team comps a big time struggle for myself when I have to choose between the role that suits the team or my team adjusts the comp around my pick. I think Irelia shouldn't be confined solely to top lane and given some freedom to fill multiple roles. Thank you for taking the time to read my comment and all the hard work that's been put into the rework, it looks amazing and has blown me away these last few weeks of anticipation.

Why are people so pissed about this? Reav3 had said Irelia's rework was aiming her as a solo lane. Still, they gave her interactions with monsters and AP ratios to make alternative builds work "fine" (jungler and ap irelia), but this doesn't implies that this are her optimized way to play.

She can jungling fine, even with the nerfs (she still has the mark on monsters). Just isn't her primarly role, and that's ok. RiotRepertoir made valid points, they know that reworking a champion implies on keep their essence and playstyle. Now I ask you, which large rework (I said large, VGU, relaunch) changed the role of a champion? Let's take a look at the lastest reworks?

* Poppy
* Taric
* Ryze
* Yorick
* Warwick
* Galio
* Urgot
* Evelynn
* Swain

None of them changed the role of this champions, even the Poppy jungle and Warwick top that were used rarely before still be used sometimes today. Urgot was used as ADC back in Season 2, but after that, he changed to solo laner and this became his main role.

Graves isn't a valid argument, because he was reworked in a different kind of project, and Riot had already said that this "Classes Reworks" didn't hit the mark. They even reverted Kog, Rengar and now Leblanc.

So, stop complaining guys, she still can jungling as much as the current Irelia can (even better IMO). This is not a new champion like Repertoir said, it's a rework and they can't just make her jungle potential outshine her solo lane performance.
